column4: ok. i have Windows Vista on my primary hdd, which is SATA. I just added a second hdd (IDE) onto which I have installed Ubuntu. I tried configuring grub so it would allow me to boot from Vista, but it ended up corrupting the volume. I had to reinstall Windows. How should I do this right?
That should be an easy one...
Point the BIOS to boot from the IDE drive first and let grub choose.
That way you don't even touch the windows drive.
but what do I put in the grub config file?
Now that's a good question. I don't know if there is a Vista specific line needed.
preface comments with the nick of the intended recipient.
no problem. You probably need the grub entry to be sd0 or something as it's a serial drive...
I see. Where could I read more about this?
thanks much. I will try this now......
